topic.title: Page Headers and Footers - Built-in CSS

body.p: All page definitions are found in: [PLUGIN_DIR]css/print/p-pages-and-headers.css.

section.title: Default Page
section.p: The default page imposes a header that contains the publication title, chapter, and section title. They alternate on the left or right side of the page:

section.title: Chapter Page
section.p: This is inherited from the default page. The chapter page is associated to the topics marked as chapters, usually the ones that are direct children of the map. It clears the header from the first page of each chapter.

section.title: Front Matter and Back Matter page
section.p: The bookmap front matter and back matter page. It clears the headers.

section.title: Blank Pages
section.p: Clears the header for the blank pages that may be created by a page-break-before, page-break-after, or by using double side pagination:

section.title: Index Page
section.p: The page that contains the index terms (appears only if there are such items in your topics). It uses a lower roman page number in the footer:
When transformed with Chemistry, the page layout is spread on two columns.
